metadata.Title: CVE-2014-7300 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: GNOME Shell 3.14.x before 3.14.1, when the Screen Lock feature is used, does not limit the aggregate memory consumption of all active PrtSc requests, which allows physically proximate attackers to execute arbitrary commands on an unattended workstation by making many PrtSc requests and leveraging a temporary lock outage, and the resulting temporary shell availability, caused by the Linux kernel OOM killer.

criterions.comment: gnome-shell: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
